page.title: 13Cragside
page.content: Cragside was once the private home of Lord Armstrong but it is now in the care of the National Trust and is open to the public. It is a nineteenth century building which stands on the hillside to the north east of the village. It stands in a woodland setting with many rhododendrons. The house can be seen from our school field and in June the rhododendrons are very colourful. Inside the house you can see an old_fashioned kitchen, different inventions and many valuable items. In the grounds there are interesting walks so it is wise to park your car and explore them. you will find the lakes and an adventure playground. They recently opened a classroom for visiting schools above the old stable block and we were first to use it.
